Create a New Dashboard

Use this task to create a new dashboard in PW EMS Monitoring and Reporting.

  1. In the navigation bar, select the Dashboard icon .
  2. From the Dashboard pop-up menu, click Manage.
  3. In the Dashboards window that displays, click New Dashboard.
  4. In the New dashboard window, click Add an empty panel.
  5. In the New dashboard / Edit Panel page that appears, click the Query tab below the graph, and select Clickhouse as the data source.
  6. Click the Pencil icon to display a text box where you can write the query.
    The following table describes the variables and formulas used in the written query:

    Variable

    Formula
    $timeseries

    (intDiv(toUInt32(timestamp), Interval) * Interval) * 1000 as Time,

    Replace Interval parameter in the formula with the number of seconds.
    $timefilter

    timestamp >= toDateTime($from) AND timestamp <= toDateTime($to)

    • $from - Start time
    • $to - End time
  7. If you want to do multiple queries, click +Query below the text box.
  8. To select the time period, click the Clock icon above the graph.
  9. In the Absolute time range dialog box specify the From and To fields.
    Also from this dialog box, the default browser time (UTC) can be changed by clicking Change Time Zone and select the appropriate time zone from the drop-down list.
  10. Select Table from the Format as drop-down list to present data in a tabular display of information or select TimeSeries from the Format as drop-down list to present data in a graphical format.
  11. Click Show options in the top-right corner of the page to make Panel selections.
  12. In the Panel tab, click Settings and complete the following fields:

    Field

    Description

    Panel Title

    		 Enter a name for the graphical panel that you are creating.

    Password

    		 Enter a panel description that supports the markdown text and its links.
    Transparent toggle bar Click the toggle bar to the right to display the panel without a background. This option is in the off position (greyed) by default.
  13. In the Panel tab, click Visualization to select what type of graph that you want to make.
  14. Click Apply to save the panel.
  15. The panel that you created appears in the new dashboard.
  16. Click the Save icon at the top of the window to save your new dashboard and panel(s).
  17. In the Save dashboard as... dialog box, complete the following fields:

    Field

    Description

    Dashboard name

    		 Enter a name for the new dashboard that you are creating.

    Folder

    		 Enter a the managed folder in which this dasboard is kept.
    Copy tags toggle bar Click the toggle bar to copy tags that are annotated in this dashboard from which to filter. This option is in the off position (greyed) by default.
